text: When building Literate.jl examples with Documenter.jl, it seems that output from the examples is suppressed in the build log. Is there any way to not do this? Couldn't find a relevant feature in `Literate.markdown` or `Documenter.makedocs` but maybe I wasn't looking for the right thing...

elements.text: When building Literate.jl examples with Documenter.jl, it seems that output from the examples is suppressed in the build log. Is there any way to not do this? Couldn't find a relevant feature in
but maybe I wasn't looking for the right thing...

text: Output is captured to be included in the docs

elements.text: Output is captured to be included in the docs

text: Ah ok I see. So there's no way to also pipe output to the terminal I guess?

elements.text: Ah ok I see. So there's no way to also pipe output to the terminal I guess?

text: Sometimes the docs build hangs when building an example and you can't figure out what happened from the build log so you have to run the examples manually.

elements.text: Sometimes the docs build hangs when building an example and you can't figure out what happened from the build log so you have to run the examples manually.

text: Documenter should be a bit more loud if you enable debug output

elements.text: Documenter should be a bit more loud if you enable debug output

text: True. I had to turn off `JULIA_DEBUG=all` for CI otherwise doctests fail but could enable it locally to help out. I guess example output is still captured but should be more useful!
